meanings.definition: The plural form of plateful, meaning a full plate of food.
meanings.sent1: At the party, everyone enjoyed the delicious platesful of snacks.
meanings.sent2: She served platesful of spaghetti to the hungry guests at the dinner.
meanings.sent3: The platesful of cookies disappeared quickly at the bake sale.
meanings.sent4: The buffet table was a colorful sea of platesful of different dishes.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of platesful of freshly baked bread filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: The plural form of plateful, meaning a large amount or quantity.
meanings.sent1: The store offered platesful of discounts during the holiday sale.
meanings.sent2: He had platesful of work to finish before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The team celebrated their victory with platesful of high-fives.
meanings.sent4: The library shelves were filled with platesful of books on various topics.
meanings.sent5: The garden was blooming with platesful of colorful flowers in the spring.
